channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-19644] change WM syntax to avoid conflicts with identifiers starting with a number
item.description: Time/etc literals conflict with non-ANSI query column names starting with a number that were previously supported without quotes (e.g. 30days).
item.summary: change WM syntax to avoid conflicts with identifiers starting with a number

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: ashutoshc can you take a look? I tried to change StringLiteral to be either existing generic patterns or the new ones in quotes (after adding quotes to the new ones themselves), but that doesn't get recognized as StringLiteral in select list. So, I just replaced it w/a string literal.

+1
Thing to note that : Quotes around time unit feel unnatural. Since, identifiers are not allowed to begin with digits in standard (other DBs disallow that) we can allow the original grammar but that would break back compat of Hive. So, when we break compatibility (in next major version) by disallowing identifiers beginning with digits we may revert this patch. In the meanwhile, we can allow this with config (default to false) which makes Hive compliant. If thats useful that can be a followup.

ashutoshc making parser configurable is going to be a pain as far as I can tell, since the new tokens (that are removed by this patch) need to either be present for original WM behavior, or absent to avoid parse-time conflict.
Agree about breaking compat later.. for the config someone can do a follow-up if desired

-1 overall
